go_data.justification: Terpene synthases (TPSs) release diphosphate from GPP and FPP, and the remaining reactive carbocation intermediates are intra-molecularly cyclized in almost all cases, yielding monoterpenes and sesquiterpenes, respectively.
TPSs initiate these reactions, cleaving diphosphate, aspartic acid (D)-rich motifs of TPS interact with diphosphate through intervening three Mg2+ ions and water molecules, yielding monoterpenes.
TPSs initiate these reactions, cleaving diphosphate, aspartic acid (D)-rich motifs of TPS interact with diphosphate through intervening three Mg2+ ions and water molecules, yielding sesquiterpenes.
Although not explicitly stated for Tps, terpene synthases are generally known to be located in the cytoplasm.
